skill.author: Doyajin174

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or filesystem access beyond standard AI tool permissions. The skill provides workflow guidance for safe batch execution of implementation plans.

content.user_title: Execute implementation plans in safe batches
content.value_statement: Complex implementation plans often lead to errors when executed all at once. This skill breaks plans into controlled batches with mandatory review checkpoints, ensuring safe incremental progress with architectural oversight.
actual_capabilities: Load and critically review implementation plans before starting
Execute work in controlled batches of 3 tasks
Report progress with verification results between batches
Identify blockers and unclear instructions requiring clarification
Apply architect feedback between execution batches
Integrate with planning, review, and finishing workflows
limitations: Requires a pre-written implementation plan to execute
Does not create or modify plans itself
Cannot make decisions about unclear requirements without input
Only executes what is explicitly defined in the provided plan

use_cases.title: Oversee safe implementation
use_cases.description: Architects provide plans and receive checkpoints to review progress before approving the next batch.

use_cases.title: Coordinate team execution
use_cases.description: Senior developers break down complex features and delegate execution with built-in safety checkpoints.

use_cases.title: Follow plans safely
use_cases.description: AI assistants execute implementation plans incrementally with architectural review between batches.

prompt_templates.title: Start batch execution
prompt_templates.prompt: Execute the provided implementation plan using the executing-plans skill. Start by loading and reviewing the plan.

prompt_templates.title: Handle blockers
prompt_templates.prompt: A blocker was discovered during batch execution. Use the executing-plans skill to stop and report the issue clearly.

prompt_templates.title: Request clarification
prompt_templates.prompt: The plan has an unclear section. Use executing-plans to pause and request clarification before proceeding.

prompt_templates.title: Complete and finish
prompt_templates.scenario: All tasks in the plan are done
prompt_templates.prompt: The final batch is complete. Use executing-plans to finish the development branch with proper completion steps.

best_practices: Always review the full plan before starting execution to identify potential issues early.
Never skip verification steps - run tests, linters, and build checks after each task.
Report blockers immediately rather than making assumptions about how to resolve them.
Wait for architect feedback between batches before continuing with the next set of tasks.
anti_patterns: Executing multiple batches without waiting for feedback between them.
Skipping verification steps because tests seem to be passing.
Making assumptions about unclear requirements instead of asking for clarification.
Continuing past blockers instead of stopping and reporting them immediately.

faq.question: What is the default batch size?
faq.answer: The default batch size is 3 tasks per batch. This provides enough work to be productive while maintaining frequent review checkpoints.

faq.question: Can I change the batch size?
faq.answer: Yes, you can specify a different batch size when starting execution. Smaller batches provide more frequent review points for complex work.

faq.question: What tools does this skill use?
faq.answer: This skill uses Read, Glob, Grep, Bash, Edit, Write, and Task tools to execute plan tasks and perform verifications.

faq.question: Is my code safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-based safety skill that adds checkpoints and verifications. It only executes code explicitly defined in your plan.

faq.question: What happens if a task fails?
faq.answer: The skill stops the batch, reports the failure with details, and waits for guidance on how to proceed before continuing.

faq.question: How is this different from executing tasks directly?
faq.answer: This skill adds structure with review checkpoints, mandatory verifications, and stopping points for blockers and unclear instructions.
